audioFiles.speaker: Dev A
audioFiles.text: Hey there Brandon, what are you working on?

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: I'm working on the next big thing for Regis... a revolutionary 12-month development roadmap.

audioFiles.speaker: Dev A
audioFiles.text: Cool! How far along are you?

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: Well, I started about... 20 minutes ago?

audioFiles.speaker: Dev A
audioFiles.text: You're kidding, right? That would normally take weeks!

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: Nope. I've got an AI copilot now. It's like having a senior developer who never needs coffee breaks sitting next to me.

audioFiles.speaker: Dev A
audioFiles.text: So you're just... what? Supervising the AI while it codes?

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: More like collaborating. I tell it what I need, it handles the tedious parts, and I focus on the architecture and creative stuff. Look at this - it's like having superpowers.

audioFiles.speaker: Dev A
audioFiles.text: That's... actually pretty impressive. So what happens to our jobs when AI writes all the code?

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: That's like asking what happened to architects when we invented power tools. We build bigger, better things! We just don't waste time hammering every nail manually anymore.

audioFiles.speaker: Dev A
audioFiles.text: So instead of typing out another FOR loop, you're thinking about solving actual problems?

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: Exactly! Less typing, more thinking. By next year, I'll barely touch the keyboard.

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: Nope, it's just the new reality. Look at these stats - today AI writes about 65% of new code. By mid-2025, it'll be 90%...

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: 100%! Then we'll all just be prompt engineers with computer science degrees.

audioFiles.speaker: Dev A
audioFiles.text: So what happens when the AI makes a mistake?

audioFiles.speaker: Dev B
audioFiles.text: Same thing that happens when I make one - we fix it. But get this - it makes 50% fewer bugs than I do.
